message.entry: Bit range ([start end], 0-based relative to LSB):

Output bits from a floating-point input. Use the "Output mode" parameter to select the bits to output. Selecting "Sign", "Mantissa", or "Exponent" outputs the corresponding bits from the IEEE 754 representation of the input.
Bit range value {0,number,integer} in parameter ''{1}'' must be less than the number of bits, {2,number,integer}, for input data type ''{3}'' in block ''{4}''.
Parameter ''{0}'' in block ''{1}'' must be a vector of two elements.
The lower bound of parameter ''{0}'' must be less than its upper bound in block ''{1}''.
The word length of the output data type must match the range length specified by 'Range of bits' parameter of the Float Extract Bits block ''{0}''.
Output data type provided must be uint64, uint32, or uint16 for the Float Extract Bits block ''{0}''.
Output data type provided must be ufix(1) when 'Mode' is set to 'Sign' for the Float Extract Bits block ''{0}''.
Output data type must be ufix(1), ufix(23), or ufix(10) when 'Mode' is set to 'Mantissa' for the Float Extract Bits block ''{0}''.
Output data type must be ufix(11), ufix(8), or ufix(5) when 'Mode' is set to 'Exponent' for the Float Extract Bits block ''{0}''.
